[002:LSCR#0212](14)\255\010\098\167\255\010\120\008\255\010\014\000\255\010\000\000Some people have no\016faith^
[002:LSCR#0212](14)\255\010\094\243\255\010\120\008\255\010\014\000\255\010\000\000^I'll meet you in your\016office.
[002:LSCR#0213](14)\255\010\090\063\255\010\121\008\255\010\010\000\255\010\000\000Where do you think you're going?
[002:LSCR#0213](14)\255\010\175\134\255\010\121\008\255\010\014\000\255\010\000\000Hey, smart guy^
[002:LSCR#0213](27)\255\010\200\055\255\010\108\008\255\010\014\000\255\010\000\000I've found the Lost Dialogue, and I'm off to find\016Atlantis!
[002:LSCR#0213](27)\255\010\073\200\255\010\108\008\255\010\010\000\255\010\000\000I'm not\016sure.

[010:SCRP#0049](14)Indy
[010:SCRP#0049](14)power
[010:SCRP#0049](14)health
[010:SCRP#0050](14)\255\006\089\001
[010:SCRP#0050](14)power
[010:SCRP#0050](14)health
[010:SCRP#0057](14)Indy's savage beating convinced
[010:SCRP#0057](14)Omar to cooperate with the Nazis.
[010:SCRP#0057](14)Later he traded Indy's whip for
[010:SCRP#0057](14)a clay pot.
[010:SCRP#0057](14)After losing the fight, Indy
[010:SCRP#0057](14)was devoured by vultures
[010:SCRP#0057](14)and scorpions.
[010:SCRP#0057](14)Rolf was easily fooled,
[010:SCRP#0057](14)but not so easily felled.
[010:SCRP#0057](14)Klaus dragged Indy into
[010:SCRP#0057](14)the Labyrinth, where someday
[010:SCRP#0057](14)someone will find the bones.
[010:SCRP#0057](14)Hans turned Indy over to Kerner
[010:SCRP#0057](14)and was decorated for valor.
[010:SCRP#0057](14)Indy was shot on the spot.
[010:SCRP#0057](14)Taking revenge for Hans, Franz
[010:SCRP#0057](14)hurled Indy into a bottomless
[010:SCRP#0057](14)pit, where his remains remain
[010:SCRP#0057](14)to this day.
[010:SCRP#0057](14)Otto tried to hurl Indy into
[010:SCRP#0057](14)a bottomless pit, but tripped
[010:SCRP#0057](14)and fell in himself.  No one
[010:SCRP#0057](14)knows what happened to Indy.
[010:SCRP#0057](14)Karl summoned his superiors,
[010:SCRP#0057](14)who shot Indy on sight.
[010:SCRP#0057](14)Kurt summoned his superiors,
[010:SCRP#0057](14)who interrogated Indy, then
[010:SCRP#0057](14)tortured and shot him.  But
[010:SCRP#0057](14)they never did find Atlantis.
[010:SCRP#0057](14)After flattening Indy, Anton
[010:SCRP#0057](14)received a field promotion.
[010:SCRP#0057](14)Later he led the charge
[010:SCRP#0057](14)on Stalingrad.
[010:SCRP#0057](14)After flattening Indy,
[010:SCRP#0057](14)Arnold went on to become a
[010:SCRP#0057](14)world-famous opera singer.
[010:SCRP#0057](14)Indy's failure to subdue a
[010:SCRP#0057](14)sixty-year-old U-Boat captain
[010:SCRP#0057](14)allowed the Nazis to conquer
[010:SCRP#0057](14)the world.
[010:SCRP#0057](14)Indy discovered Atlantis, but
[010:SCRP#0057](14)the Nazis won the race to
[010:SCRP#0057](14)unearth its secrets.
[010:SCRP#0057](14)After defeating Indy, Fritz
[010:SCRP#0057](14)boxed his way to a gold medal
[010:SCRP#0057](14)in the 1948 Olympic Games.
[010:SCRP#0057](14)Indy lost the fistfight and
[010:SCRP#0057](14)with it his chance to unearth
[010:SCRP#0057](14)the secrets of Atlantis.
[010:SCRP#0057](14)Unfortunately, Indy couldn't
[010:SCRP#0057](14)hold his breath as long as
[010:SCRP#0057](14)Guybrush Threepwood.
[010:SCRP#0057](14)Indy was swallowed up just
[010:SCRP#0057](14)moments before discovering
[010:SCRP#0057](14)the final secret of Atlantis.
[010:SCRP#0057](14)Kerner recovered the stone
[010:SCRP#0057](14)disks and blew himself up
[010:SCRP#0057](14)tinkering with the orichalcum
[010:SCRP#0057](14)he found in Atlantis.
[010:SCRP#0057](14)After Indy's fatal transformation,
[010:SCRP#0057](14)Atlantis shook itself to pieces,
[010:SCRP#0057](14)sealing its secrets and the Nazis
[010:SCRP#0057](14)in molten lava.
[010:SCRP#0057](14)Indy's overly reckless
[010:SCRP#0057](14)behavior won Rolf a medal
[010:SCRP#0057](14)for bravery.
[010:SCRP#0057](14)Indy's overly passive
[010:SCRP#0057](14)behavior won Rolf a medal
[010:SCRP#0057](14)for personal initiative.
[010:SCRP#0057](14)Because the sailors proved
[010:SCRP#0057](14)to be reasonably alert,
[010:SCRP#0057](14)Indy soon found himself
[010:SCRP#0057](14)in deep, deep water.
[010:SCRP#0057](14)Suddenly, Indy forgot everything
[010:SCRP#0057](14)he knew about handling a bullwhip
[010:SCRP#0057](14)and flogged himself to death.
[010:SCRP#0057](14)With the stone disks in his
[010:SCRP#0057](14)possession, Kerner discovered
[010:SCRP#0057](14)Atlantis and drowned.
[010:SCRP#0057](14)Unfortunately,
[010:SCRP#0057](14)Sophia's guard knew a
[010:SCRP#0057](14)wise guy when he met one.
[010:SCRP#0057](14)Indy Quotient^

[011:LSCR#0200](14)\255\010\208\054\255\010\052\000\255\010\018\000\255\010\000\000Here, my friends, is ATLANTIS^ 
[011:LSCR#0200](14)\255\010\068\156\255\010\052\000\255\010\014\000\255\010\000\000^as it might have appeared\255\001in its heyday^ \255\009\019\000 
[011:LSCR#0200](14)\255\010\095\003\255\010\053\000\255\010\026\000\255\010\000\000^glorious^\255\003^glorious^\255\001^prosperous^\255\003^glorious^\255\001^prosperous^\255\001^socially and technically advanced^  
[011:LSCR#0200](14)\255\010\105\200\255\010\053\000\255\010\010\000\255\010\000\000^beyond our wildest dreams!
[011:LSCR#0200](14)\255\010\103\038\255\010\054\000\255\010\022\000\255\010\000\0005,000 years ago,\255\001while everyone else still wore animal skins^
[011:LSCR#0200](14)\255\010\140\219\255\010\054\000\255\010\030\000\255\010\000\000^the mighty spirits of Atlantis dared\255\001to build a city where knowledge and power\255\001were united in true happiness.
[011:LSCR#0200](14)\255\010\199\045\255\010\056\000\255\010\030\000\255\010\000\000Centuries later,\255\001the famous philosopher Plato wrote about it^\255\003He placed Atlantis on a continent\255\009\019\000 \255\001out in the deep ocean^
[011:LSCR#0200](14)\255\010\012\153\255\010\057\000\255\010\018\000\255\010\000\000^and described how it was divided into\255\0013 circular parts^\255\009\011\000
[011:LSCR#0200](14)\255\010\120\066\255\010\058\000\255\010\014\000\255\010\000\000^such as you see here^ \255\009\012\000
[011:LSCR#0200](14)

[048:LSCR#0202](14)\255\010\232\108\255\010\172\000\255\010\026\000\255\010\000\000Amazing!\255\003We're hundreds of feet below sea\016level^\255\003^yet there's enough air pressure to keep the water\016out.\255\003How is it possible?
[048:LSCR#0202](14)\255\010\015\113\255\010\192\000\255\010\010\000\255\010\000\000Welcome to Atlantis, Indy.

[059:LSCR#0202](14)\255\010\009\057\255\010\091\006\255\010\010\000\255\010\000\000*grunt*
[059:LSCR#0202](14)\255\010\224\130\255\010\091\006\255\010\014\000\255\010\000\000Come on door, MOVE!

[071:LSCR#0205](14)\255\010\214\173\255\010\241\006\255\010\014\000\255\010\000\000Un moment, s'il vous plait.\255\003I think I remember^\255\003^yes^
[071:LSCR#0205](14)\255\010\029\030\255\010\204\006\255\010\018\000\255\010\000\000Could you repeat that?\255\003French names give me\016fits.
[071:LSCR#0205](14)\255\010\007\056\255\010\242\006\255\010\014\000\255\010\000\000Better yet, I'll write it on this\016telegram.
[071:LSCR#0205](14)\255\010\116\168\255\010\242\006\255\010\010\000\255\010\000\000Here.
[071:LSCR#0205](54)telegram with address
[071:LSCR#0205](14)\255\010\061\145\255\010\204\006\255\010\014\000\255\010\000\000Thanks.
[071:LSCR#0205](14)\255\010\083\191\255\010\242\006\255\010\018\000\255\010\000\000Good luck and Godspeed in your\016search.

[072:OBNA#0988](__)door

[082:LSCR#0202](D8)\255\010\017\206\255\010\012\007\255\010\014\000\255\010\000\000Whoa!
[082:LSCR#0202](14)\255\010\139\252\255\010\012\007\255\010\018\000\255\010\000\000Oh boy^\255\003I've got maybe three\255\001minutes of air in my\016suit^\255\003^better start hiking^
[083:LSCR#0201](14)\008THE HERMOCRATES\008 
[083:LSCR#0201](14)Now at last I have
[083:LSCR#0201](14)Plato's Lost Dialogue
[083:LSCR#0201](14)translated entirely.
[083:LSCR#0201](14)The Greek original is
[083:LSCR#0201](14)lost, so I've used the
[083:LSCR#0201](14)Arabic text I found in
[083:LSCR#0201](14)an Italian monastery
[083:LSCR#0201](14)years ago and always
[083:LSCR#0201](14)thought was a hoax.
[083:LSCR#0201](14)Now I wonder ^ could
[083:LSCR#0201](14)this remarkable book
[083:LSCR#0201](14)hold the secret to
[083:LSCR#0201](14)long-lost Atlantis?
[083:LSCR#0201](14)Probably not.  No one
[083:LSCR#0201](14)will publish it, that's
[083:LSCR#0201](14)certain.  The fear of
[083:LSCR#0201](14)ridicule is too great.
[083:LSCR#0201](14)To be safe, I've sent a
[083:LSCR#0201](14)copy to \255\007\039\000.
[083:LSCR#0201](14)       London, 1922
[083:LSCR#0202](14)HERMOCRATES:
[083:LSCR#0202](14)In shame I hereby do
[083:LSCR#0202](14)recant the time and
[083:LSCR#0202](14)place whereof Critias
[083:LSCR#0202](14)spoke.  In rendering
[083:LSCR#0202](14)Egyptian into Greek he
[083:LSCR#0202](14)made a tenfold error.
[083:LSCR#0202](14)Instead of lying 3,000
[083:LSCR#0202](14)miles hence, Atlantis
[083:LSCR#0202](14)may well have been
[083:LSCR#0202](14)30,000 miles away.  Or
[083:LSCR#0202](14)perhaps it was less
[083:LSCR#0202](14)than 300 miles from
[083:LSCR#0202](14)our own shores.
[083:LSCR#0202](14)Likewise, it may be
[083:LSCR#0202](14)that the Lost Kingdom
[083:LSCR#0202](14)held sway as many as
[083:LSCR#0202](14)100,000 years ago, or
[083:LSCR#0202](14)as few as 1,000.
[083:LSCR#0202](14)SOCRATES:
[083:LSCR#0202](14)If a kingdom arose on
[083:LSCR#0202](14)Earth beyond anywhere
[083:LSCR#0202](14)men might travel, then
[083:LSCR#0202](14)we would never hear of
[083:LSCR#0202](14)it.  We ought to accept
[083:LSCR#0202](14)the lesser figure.
[083:LSCR#0203](14)^so glorious Atlantis
[083:LSCR#0203](14)founded two colonies,
[083:LSCR#0203](14)the Lesser \255\004\239\000 miles
[083:LSCR#0203](14)northeast of the City
[083:LSCR#0203](14)north of the City
[083:LSCR#0203](14)northwest of the City
[083:LSCR#0203](14)and the Greater \255\004\186\001
[083:LSCR#0203](14)miles away southwest.
[083:LSCR#0203](14)miles to the south.
[083:LSCR#0203](14)miles away southeast.
[083:LSCR#0203](14)Gates of the kingdom
[083:LSCR#0203](14)opened only with the
[083:LSCR#0203](14)aid of special stones.
[083:LSCR#0203](14)At many outposts, a
[083:LSCR#0203](14)Sunstone sufficed, if
[083:LSCR#0203](14)hot sunlight bathed
[083:LSCR#0203](14)the tall horns.
[083:LSCR#0203](14)sunset made the tall
[083:LSCR#0203](14)horns red.
[083:LSCR#0203](14)darkness concealed
[083:LSCR#0203](14)the tall horns.
[083:LSCR#0203](14)morning light warmed
[083:LSCR#0203](14)the tall horns.
[083:LSCR#0203](14)At the Greater Colony
[083:LSCR#0203](14)a Moonstone was also
[083:LSCR#0203](14)needed, with the noon
[083:LSCR#0203](14)sun riding above the
[083:LSCR#0203](14)full moon.
[083:LSCR#0203](14)needed, with darkest
[083:LSCR#0203](14)night healed by the
[083:LSCR#0203](14)full moon.
[083:LSCR#0203](14)needed, with pale dawn
[083:LSCR#0203](14)to shred the darkest
[083:LSCR#0203](14)night.
[083:LSCR#0203](14)needed, with the sun
[083:LSCR#0203](14)dying as a new moon
[083:LSCR#0203](14)is born.
[083:LSCR#0203](14)To approach Atlantis
[083:LSCR#0203](14)itself a Worldstone
[083:LSCR#0203](14)was required as well,
[083:LSCR#0203](14)with the dying orbs
[083:LSCR#0203](14)plummeting into the
[083:LSCR#0203](14)eastern sea.
[083:LSCR#0203](14)with darkness ruling
[083:LSCR#0203](14)the old city without
[083:LSCR#0203](14)challenge.
[083:LSCR#0203](14)with the moon, full
[083:LSCR#0203](14)of beauty unrivaled,
[083:LSCR#0203](14)lighting the city.
[083:LSCR#0203](14)with a glorious sun
[083:LSCR#0203](14)blazing alone upon
[083:LSCR#0203](14)the western sea.
[083:LSCR#0203](14)with the rising sun
[083:LSCR#0203](14)breaking night's grip
[083:LSCR#0203](14)above the fiery peak.
[083:LSCR#0203](14)with only a waning
[083:LSCR#0203](14)moon to protect the
[083:LSCR#0203](14)city from grim night.
[083:LSCR#0203](14)with darkest night
[083:LSCR#0203](14)soon to rule the
[083:LSCR#0203](14)western sea.
[083:LSCR#0203](14)with a waxing moon
[083:LSCR#0203](14)the sky's only reply
[083:LSCR#0203](14)to the fires below.
[083:LSCR#0203](14)Final entrance yielded
[083:LSCR#0203](14)only to contrary minds.
[083:LSCR#0204](14)^and it is said that
[083:LSCR#0204](14)dwellers in Atlantis
[083:LSCR#0204](14)had no horses nor any
[083:LSCR#0204](14)need of them.
[083:LSCR#0204](14)Orichalcum, the metal
[083:LSCR#0204](14)that glittered like
[083:LSCR#0204](14)fire, this they had
[083:LSCR#0204](14)instead.  They cast it
[083:LSCR#0204](14)into shiny beads and
[083:LSCR#0204](14)used them as we do
[083:LSCR#0204](14)minted coins, paying
[083:LSCR#0204](14)statues to do their
[083:LSCR#0204](14)work as if by magic.
[083:LSCR#0204](14)When their colonies
[083:LSCR#0204](14)were failing, wise
[083:LSCR#0204](14)men carved strange
[083:LSCR#0204](14)devices out of amber
[083:LSCR#0204](14)to search for the
[083:LSCR#0204](14)metal, but only proud
[083:LSCR#0204](14)Atlantis ever yielded
[083:LSCR#0204](14)a supply.
[083:LSCR#0204](14)SOCRATES:
[083:LSCR#0204](14)You have called the
[083:LSCR#0204](14)kingdom wealthy, but
[083:LSCR#0204](14)surely this is absurd.
[083:LSCR#0205](14)^as the waters rose
[083:LSCR#0205](14)around their city, the
[083:LSCR#0205](14)Kings of Atlantis, one
[083:LSCR#0205](14)after another, sought
[083:LSCR#0205](14)to hold off fate.
[083:LSCR#0205](14)Knowing mortal men
[083:LSCR#0205](14)would never rule the
[083:LSCR#0205](14)sea, they planned a
[083:LSCR#0205](14)huge colossus, which
[083:LSCR#0205](14)by use of orichalcum,
[083:LSCR#0205](14)ten beads at a time,
[083:LSCR#0205](14)would make them like
[083:LSCR#0205](14)the gods themselves.
[083:LSCR#0205](14)Nur-Ab-Sal was one
[083:LSCR#0205](14)such king.  He it was,
[083:LSCR#0205](14)say the wise men of
[083:LSCR#0205](14)Egypt, who first put
[083:LSCR#0205](14)men in the colossus,
[083:LSCR#0205](14)making many freaks of
[083:LSCR#0205](14)nature at times when
[083:LSCR#0205](14)the celestial spheres
[083:LSCR#0205](14)were well aligned.
[083:LSCR#0205](14)SOCRATES:
[083:LSCR#0205](14)This I doubt.  We are
[083:LSCR#0205](14)hearing a child's tale.
